newsitem.title: GERMANY: German SPD urges Kohl to leave Asia early.
newsitem.headline: German SPD urges Kohl to leave Asia early.

text.p: Germany's opposition Social Democrats on Monday called on Chancellor Helmut Kohl to break off his Asia visit to answer questions in parliament about the German budget, but Kohl's office said he would not do so.
Kohl is scheduled to travel to the Phillipines from Indonesia on Tuesday and continue on to Japan.

SPD parliamentary faction leader Rudolf Scharping told a news conference Kohl should come home for a special parliamentary session on Wednesday to explain how the government plans to end the current "financial chaos."
A sluggish economy early in the year and continued high unemployment have caused the deficit to widen from initial projections despite deep spending cuts.
Chancellery Minister Friedrich Bohl called the SPD suggestion laughable, and said Kohl would not interrupt an important trip to participate in the planned session.
Scharping said the SPD wants the government to declare that the German economy is out of balance, since borrowing is likely to exceed public investment this year, Scharping said.

Such excess borrowing is forbidden by Germany's Basic Law except to "correct a disturbance of the overall economic balance." The 1996 budget also does not accurately detail all revenues and expenditures, Scharping said.
